org.beiter.michael.authn.jaas.common.authenticator

Interface PasswordAuthenticator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DummyPasswordAuthenticator

    public interface PasswordAuthenticator
    An interface representing a username / password based authentication mechanism.

    Classes implementing this interface must be thread safe.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Subject authenticate(String domain, String userName, char[] password, PasswordValidator passwordValidator)
      Authenticate a user by validating the user's password, returning a Subject with one or more Principals set (if validation was successful), or throw a LoginException (if validation fails)
      void init(Map<String,?> properties)
      Initializes the authenticator configuration

      A class implementing this interface must provide a reasonable default configuration and handle situations where the validate() method is called without a previous call of init() (i.e.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(Map<String,?> properties)
        Initializes the authenticator configuration

        A class implementing this interface must provide a reasonable default configuration and handle situations where the validate() method is called without a previous call of init() (i.e. do not throw a runtime exception).

        A class implementing this interface must ensure that subsequent calls to this method update the class' configuration in a thread-safe way.

        Parameters:
        properties - The properties to initialize the message queue with. Supported parameters may vary with the implementing classes.

      • authenticate

        Subject authenticate(String domain,
                     String userName,
                     char[] password,
                     PasswordValidator passwordValidator)
              throws LoginException
        Authenticate a user by validating the user's password, returning a Subject with one or more Principals set (if validation was successful), or throw a LoginException (if validation fails)
        Parameters:
        domain - The white label domain in which the username is located
        userName - The username to authenticate with
        password - The password to authenticate with
        passwordValidator - The validator to use for the password
        Returns:
        a callback for querying subject attributes.
        Throws:
        LoginException - when this LoginModule is unable to perform the authentication. Catch a FailedLoginException to determine if the authentication failed due to an incorrect password
